snippet: Thirty years to the day after Haiti’s last dictator fled and the country took its first wobbly steps toward democracy, another leader stepped down Sunday without a successor to take his place.
abstract: Haitian president Michel Martelly leaves office, ending his five-year term amid criticism he abused his power; his departure leaves Haiti leaderless but with controversial plan to have new president installed by May.
lead_paragraph: Thirty years to the day after Haiti’s last dictator fled and the country took its first wobbly steps toward democracy, another leader stepped down Sunday without a successor to take his place.

headline.main: Michel Martelly, Haiti’s President, Departs Without a Successor
headline.print_headline: Haiti’s President Departs Without a Successor
